answerText: After Many A Summer Dies the Swan[10] After Many a Summer Dies the Swan was written by this British author, who is better known for writing about The Doors of Perception and creating John the Savage in Brave New World.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Editor's Packet 1 | 7 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At the end of this work, the characters discover the fifth Earl of Gonister, who is still wearing the remains of the Order of the Garter. For ten points each: [10] Identify this work in which Stoyte searches for immortality, and which takes its title from Tennyson's poem Tithonus.
